detailed_info.name: Polysorbate 20
detailed_info.description:
Polysorbate 20 or Tween 20 is a nonionic surfactant and a sorbitol-derived emulsifier based on fruits and berries. It helps to dilute essential oils or perfume in water-based cosmetics like lotions, creams, gels.
Polysorbate 20 is produced by ethoxylation. The number indicates the average number of moles of ethylene oxide reacted per mole of sorbitol.

functions.name: Emulsifying
functions.description: Promotes the formation of intimate mixtures between immiscible liquids by modifying the interfacial tension (water and oil)

functions.name: Surfactant
functions.description: Reduces the surface tension of cosmetics and contributes to the even distribution of the product when it is used
